message_1: How much energy is released during a nuclear explosion using a 10-kiloton atomic bomb if all of the energy is converted into thermal energy?
message_2:
A 10-kiloton atomic bomb has an energy equivalent to 10,000 tons of TNT. To convert this to joules, we can use the fact that 1 ton of TNT releases approximately 4.184 x 10^9 joules of energy. 

Energy released = (10,000 tons of TNT) x (4.184 x 10^9 joules/ton of TNT)

Energy released = 4.184 x 10^13 joules

So, during a nuclear explosion using a 10-kiloton atomic bomb, 4.184 x 10^13 joules of energy is released as thermal energy.
